Cool-Down (5 minutes)

Student-Facing Statement

Here is an equation: \( 5x−2y=10 \).

Create a second equation that would make a system of equations with:

1.One solution

2.No solutions

3.Infinitely many solutions

Student Response


1. \( 3𝑥 - 𝑦 =7 \)

2. \( 5𝑥 - 2𝑦 = 20 \)

3. \( 15𝑥 - 6𝑦 = 30 \)

Response to Student Thinking

More Chances

In Activity 2.13.4 and Activity 2.14.1 (graph B), systems of inequalities with no solutions are shown, and these will provide another opportunity to discuss when a system has no solutions and how to tell.
